alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 4:44AM PST until December 06 at 7:21AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... North Fork Stillaguamish River Near Arlington affecting Snohomish County. Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rain will continue in the North Central Washington Cascades through this afternoon. Another 2 to 4 inches of rain is forecast before the rain eases late in the day. For the North West Region...including Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillaguamish River at Arlington. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, the Stillaguamish River will cause flooding mainly in the Silvana area, along Norman Road and in Florence. A stage of 17 feet on the Stillaguamish River corresponds roughly to Phase 3 in the Snohomish County Flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:20 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 15.5 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:20 AM PST Tuesday was 15.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to rise cresting near 17.7 feet late this morning. The river will begin receding this afternoon falling below flood stage Wednesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1245 PM PST.
